bug.short_desc: Generator can not connect to Internet to check version info and fails

long_desc.thetext:
./generate.py distclean ./generate.py clean ./generate.py
->
>>> Processing configuration - Warning: ! Shadowing job "common" with local one - Warning: ! Shadowing job "libraries" with local one Could not connect to the internet. [Errno 2] No such file or directory: u'/tmp/qx1.6/cache/downloads/qxe/trunk/Manifest.json'

What is [Errno 2]?
"Could not connect to the internet." ?

What is [Errno 1]?
also
Occurred due to missing config.json in the contrib directory.
Whats wrong with that error message? "Could not connect to the internet." ... thats quite obvious what that means. So whats the problem here?

Two things: 1. what is [Errno 1] ? It does not appear in the log. Is it that it can not connect to Internet? 2. the generator stops when it can not connect to Internet to get version information.
qxe is a contrib package, but it has already been downloaded to the cache at previous connections. It would be reasonable to print an error message saying "Can not connect to Internet to get version information/download contrib package. Instead use previously downloaded versions" or something with that meaning...
...and not stopping unless there are no versions of contrib previously downloaded...

(In reply to comment #5) > ...and not stopping unless there are no versions of contrib previously > downloaded...
Agree with that.
Move open issues to RESOLVED â€“ LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
